1.brief: properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin

2.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to end (in the sense of completion or failure)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

3.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
to inhale eagerly; figuratively, to cover; by implication, to be angry; also to hasten
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

4.brief: properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
to roar; a lion (properly, a lioness as the fiercer (although not a roarer;))
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
properly, to lick, i.e. (by implication) to blaze
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
a lance (for thrusting, like pitching a tent)
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement

5.brief: to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness

6.brief: properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
a stroke, literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to dig; figuratively, to plot; generally, to bore or open
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre

7.brief: properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music

8.brief: properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
a skin-bag for liquids (from collapsing when empty); hence, a vase (as similar in shape when full); also a lyre (as having a body of like form)

9.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest

great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
